intro: Pabstiella ephemera, commonly known as the fleeting ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic plant found in specific regions of South America. It is a member of the orchid family, characterized by its delicate, ephemeral blooms that appear only briefly during the wet season. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring slender, wiry stems and small, pale flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or in rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pabstiella ephemera is considered a vulnerable species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
